page.title: 14LOCAL HISTORY 1
page.content: Manor Court House in High St. Tostig held{manor}before 1065{(Domesday Book) Passed to Crown, later to Mowbrays. Granted market & 2 fairs (1307) by Edward I. Mowbrays built { Motte & {Bailey castle.} Site (well-preserved) excavated 1904. Used as hunting lodge in Burton Chase but went out of use between 1322 and 1369. {Coal} mined in handpits at Barnoldswick, Park Foot and Faccon Farm ( Ingleton Coalfield ). Early entrepreneur, Thomas Hodgson lived at Greta Bank where hollows, spoil-heaps and traces of adits may be found. Industry petered-out in mid 19th cent. Coal taken in 1926 & 1936 causing occupation toll ( Penny ) bridge to be swept away in river floods. Roadway comes to dead end at river bank. Coal visible in river bank and bed.
